info.title: Occurrence API
info.description:
This API works against the GBIF Occurrence Store, which handles occurrence records and makes them available through the web service and download files.
Internally we use a [Java web service client](https://github.com/gbif/occurrence/tree/master/occurrence-ws-client) for the consumption of these HTTP-based, RESTful web services.

tags.name: Occurrences
tags.description: This API provides services related to the retrieval of single occurrence records.

tags.name: Occurrence downloads
tags.description: This API provides services for bulk downloads of occurrences.

tags.name: Occurrence download formats
tags.description: This API lists the fields present in the various download formats, their data types and their term identifiers.

tags.name: Searching occurrences
tags.description:
This API provides services for searching occurrence records that have been indexed by GBIF.

In order to retrieve all results for a given search filter you need to issue individual requests for each page, which is limited to a maximum size of 300 records per page. Note that for technical reasons we also have a hard limit for any query of 100,000 records. You will get an error if the offset + limit exceeds 100,000. To retrieve all records beyond 100,000 you should use our asynchronous download service (below) instead.

get.description: Full search across all occurrences. Results are ordered by relevance.

parameters.name: basisOfRecord
parameters.description: Basis of record, as defined in our BasisOfRecord vocabulary

parameters.name: catalogNumber
parameters.description: An identifier of any form assigned by the source within a physical collection or digital dataset for the record which may not be unique, but should be fairly unique in combination with the institution and collection code.

parameters.name: classKey
parameters.description: Class classification key.

parameters.name: collectionCode
parameters.description: An identifier of any form assigned by the source to identify the physical collection or digital dataset uniquely within the context of an institution.

parameters.name: continent
parameters.description: Continent, as defined in our Continent vocabulary

parameters.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
parameters.description: The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location. Supports range queries.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the country in which the occurrence was recorded.

parameters.name: crawlId
parameters.description: Crawl attempt that harvested this record.

parameters.name: datasetId
parameters.description: The ID of the dataset.

parameters.name: datasetKey
parameters.description: The occurrence dataset key (a UUID).

parameters.name: datasetName
parameters.description: The name of the dataset.

parameters.name: decimalLatitude
parameters.description: Latitude in decimals between -90 and 90 based on WGS 84. Supports range queries.

parameters.name: decimalLongitude
parameters.description: Longitude in decimals between -180 and 180 based on WGS 84. Supports range queries.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Depth in meters relative to altitude. For example 10 meters below a lake surface with given altitude. Supports range queries.

parameters.name: elevation
parameters.description: Elevation (altitude) in meters above sea level. Supports range queries.

parameters.name: establishmentMeans
parameters.description: EstablishmentMeans, as defined in our EstablishmentMeans enum

parameters.name: eventDate
parameters.description: Occurrence date in ISO 8601 format: yyyy, yyyy-MM, yyyy-MM-dd, or MM-dd. Supports range queries.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: An identifier for the information associated with a sampling event.

parameters.name: familyKey
parameters.description: Family classification key.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Export format, accepts TSV(default) and CSV

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Start partial date of a date range, accepts the format yyyy-MM, for example: 2015-11

parameters.name: gadmGid
parameters.description: A GADM geographic identifier at any level, for example AGO, AGO.1_1, AGO.1.1_1 or AGO.1.1.1_1

parameters.name: gadmLevel
parameters.description: A GADM region level, valid values range from 0 to 3

parameters.name: gadmLevel0Gid
parameters.description: A GADM geographic identifier at the zero level, for example AGO

parameters.name: gadmLevel1Gid
parameters.description: A GADM geographic identifier at the first level, for example AGO.1_1

parameters.name: gadmLevel2Gid
parameters.description: A GADM geographic identifier at the second level, for example AFG.1.1_1

parameters.name: gadmLevel3Gid
parameters.description: A GADM geographic identifier at the third level, for example AFG.1.1.1_1

parameters.name: genusKey
parameters.description: Genus classification key.

parameters.name: geoDistance
parameters.description: Filters to match occurrence records with coordinate values within a specified distance of a coordinate, it supports units: in (inch), yd (yards), ft (feet), km (kilometers), mmi (nautical miles), mm (millimeters), cm centimeters, mi (miles), m (meters), for example /occurrence/search?geoDistance=90,100,5km

parameters.name: geometry
parameters.description: Searches for occurrences inside a polygon described in Well Known Text (WKT) format. Only POINT, LINESTRING, LINEARRING, POLYGON and MULTIPOLYGON are accepted WKT types. For example, a shape written as POLYGON ((30.1 10.1, 40 40, 20 40, 10 20, 30.1 10.1)) would be queried as is, i.e. /occurrence/search?geometry=POLYGON((30.1 10.1, 40 40, 20 40, 10 20, 30.1 10.1)). _Polygons must have *anticlockwise* ordering of points, or will give unpredictable results._ (A clockwise polygon represents the opposite area: the Earth's surface with a 'hole' in it. Such queries are not supported.)

parameters.name: hasCoordinate
parameters.description: Limits searches to occurrence records which contain a value in both latitude and longitude (i.e. hasCoordinate=true limits to occurrence records with coordinate values and hasCoordinate=false limits to occurrence records without coordinate values).

parameters.name: identifiedBy
parameters.description: The person who provided the taxonomic identification of the occurrence.

parameters.name: identifiedByID
parameters.description: Identifier (e.g. ORCID) for the person who provided the taxonomic identification of the occurrence.

parameters.name: institutionCode
parameters.description: An identifier of any form assigned by the source to identify the institution the record belongs to. Not guaranteed to be unique.

parameters.name: issue
parameters.description: A specific interpretation issue as defined in our OccurrenceIssue enum

parameters.name: kingdomKey
parameters.description: Kingdom classification key.

parameters.name: lastInterpreted
parameters.description: This date the record was last modified in GBIF, in ISO 8601 format: yyyy, yyyy-MM, yyyy-MM-dd, or MM-dd. Supports range queries. Note that this is the date the record was last changed in GBIF, not necessarily the date the record was first/last changed by the publisher. Data is re-interpreted when we change the taxonomic backbone, geographic data sources, or interpretation processes.

parameters.name: license
parameters.description: The type license applied to the dataset or record.

parameters.name: locality
parameters.description: The specific description of the place.

parameters.name: mediaType
parameters.description: The kind of multimedia associated with an occurrence as defined in our MediaType enum

parameters.name: modified
parameters.description: The most recent date-time on which the resource was changed, according to the publisher

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The month of the year, starting with 1 for January. Supports range queries.

parameters.name: occurrenceId
parameters.description: A single globally unique identifier for the occurrence record as provided by the publisher.

parameters.name: occurrenceStatus
parameters.description: Either 'ABSENT' or 'PRESENT'; the presence or absence of the occurrence.

parameters.name: orderKey
parameters.description: Order classification key.

parameters.name: organismId
parameters.description: An identifier for the Organism instance (as opposed to a particular digital record of the Organism). May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

parameters.name: organismQuantity
parameters.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms.

parameters.name: organismQuantityType
parameters.description: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of organisms.

parameters.name: otherCatalogNumbers
parameters.description: Previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers.

parameters.name: phylumKey
parameters.description: Phylum classification key.

parameters.name: preparations
parameters.description: Preparation or preservation method for a specimen.

parameters.name: programme
parameters.description: A group of activities, often associated with a specific funding stream, such as the GBIF BID programme.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The identifier for a project, which is often assigned by a funded programme.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: Protocol or mechanism used to provide the occurrence record.

parameters.name: publishingCountry
parameters.description: The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the owining organization's country.

parameters.name: publishingOrg
parameters.description: The publishing organization key (a UUID).

parameters.name: publishingOrgKey
parameters.description: The publishing organization key (a uuid).

parameters.name: recordedBy
parameters.description: The person who recorded the occurrence.

parameters.name: recordedByID
parameters.description: Identifier (e.g. ORCID) for the person who recorded the occurrence.

parameters.name: recordNumber
parameters.description: An identifier given to the record at the time it was recorded in the field.

parameters.name: relativeOrganismQuantity
parameters.description: The relative measurement of the quantity of the organism (i.e. without absolute units).

parameters.name: repatriated
parameters.description: Searches for records whose publishing country is different to the country where the record was recorded in.

parameters.name: sampleSizeUnit
parameters.description: The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

parameters.name: sampleSizeValue
parameters.description: A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

parameters.name: samplingProtocol
parameters.description: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during a sampling event

parameters.name: scientificName
parameters.description: A scientific name from the [GBIF backbone](https://www.gbif.org/dataset/d7dddbf4-2cf0-4f39-9b2a-bb099caae36c). All included and synonym taxa are included in the search. Under the hood a call to the [species match service](https://www.gbif.org/developer/species#searching) is done first to retrieve a taxonKey. Only unique scientific names will return results, homonyms (many monomials) return nothing! Consider to use the taxonKey parameter instead and the species match service directly

parameters.name: speciesKey
parameters.description: Species classification key.

parameters.name: stateProvince
parameters.description: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

parameters.name: subgenusKey
parameters.description: Subgenus classification key.

parameters.name: taxonKey
parameters.description: A taxon key from the GBIF backbone. All included and synonym taxa are included in the search, so a search for aves with taxonKey=212 (i.e. /occurrence/search?taxonKey=212) will match all birds, no matter which species.

parameters.name: typeStatus
parameters.description: Nomenclatural type (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.

parameters.name: verbatimScientificName
parameters.description: The scientific name provided to GBIF by the data publisher, before interpretation and processing by GBIF.

parameters.name: verbatimTaxonId
parameters.description: The taxon identifier provided to GBIF by the data publisher.

parameters.name: waterBody
parameters.description: The name of the water body in which the Locations occurs.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The 4 digit year. A year of 98 will be interpreted as AD 98. Supports range queries.

parameters.name: hl
parameters.description: Set `hl=true` to highlight terms matching the query when in fulltext search fields. The highlight will be an emphasis tag of class `gbifH1` e.g. [`/search?q=plant&hl=true`](https://api.gbif.org/v1/literature/search?q=plant&hl=true). Fulltext search fields include: title, keyword, country, publishing country, publishing organization title, hosting organization title, and description. One additional full text field is searched which includes information from metadata documents, but the text of this field is not returned in the response.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

parameters.name: facet
parameters.description: A facet name used to retrieve the most frequent values for a field. Facets are allowed for all the parameters except for: eventDate, geometry, lastInterpreted, locality, organismId, stateProvince, waterBody. This parameter may by repeated to request multiple facets, as in this example /occurrence/search?facet=datasetKey&facet=basisOfRecord&limit=0

parameters.name: facetMincount
parameters.description: Used in combination with the facet parameter. Set facetMincount={#} to exclude facets with a count less than {#}, e.g. /search?facet=type&limit=0&facetMincount=10000 only shows the type value 'OCCURRENCE' because 'CHECKLIST' and 'METADATA' have counts less than 10000.

parameters.name: facetMultiselect
parameters.description: Used in combination with the facet parameter. Set facetMultiselect=true to still return counts for values that are not currently filtered, e.g. /search?facet=type&limit=0&type=CHECKLIST&facetMultiselect=true still shows type values 'OCCURRENCE' and 'METADATA' even though type is being filtered by type=CHECKLIST

parameters.name: facetLimit
parameters.description: Facet parameters allow paging requests using the parameters facetOffset and facetLimit

parameters.name: facetOffset
parameters.description: Facet parameters allow paging requests using the parameters facetOffset and facetLimit

400.description: Invalid query, e.g. invalid vocabulary values

post.summary: Requests the creation of a download file.
post.description: Starts the process of creating a download file. See the predicates section to consult the requests accepted by this service and the limits section to refer for information of how this service is limited per user.

get.description: Retrieve a single, verbatim occurrence without any interpretation

parameters.name: gbifId
parameters.description: Integer gbifId for the occurrence.

get.description: Retrieve a single occurrence fragment in its raw form (JSON or XML)

parameters.name: gbifId
parameters.description: Integer gbifId for the occurrence.

200.description: Occurrence fragment in JSON or XML format

get.description: **Experimental** Retrieve a list of related occurrences

parameters.name: gbifId
parameters.description: Integer gbifId for the occurrence.

200.description: Occurrence found, clusters listed if present

get.summary: Verbatim occurrence by dataset key and occurrence id
get.description: Retrieve a single, verbatim occurrence without any interpretation by its dataset key and occurrenceId

parameters.name: datasetKey
parameters.description: UUID key for the dataset.

parameters.name: occurrenceId
parameters.description: Occurrence ID from the dataset.

get.summary: Occurrence fragment by dataset key and occurrence id
get.description: Retrieve a single occurrence fragment in its raw form (JSON or XML) by its dataset key and occurrenceId in that dataset

parameters.name: datasetKey
parameters.description: UUID key for the dataset.

parameters.name: occurrenceId
parameters.description: Occurrence ID from the dataset.

get.summary: Occurrence by dataset key and occurrence id
get.description: Retrieve a single, interpreted occurrence by its dataset key and occurrenceId in that dataset

parameters.name: datasetKey
parameters.description: UUID key for the dataset.

parameters.name: occurrenceId
parameters.description: Occurrence ID from the dataset.

get.description: Lists the definitions of the terms (JSON properties, field names) of occurrences.
Search that returns matching water bodies. Results are ordered by relevance.

parameters.description: Simple search suggestion parameter. Wildcards are not supported.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Controls the number of suggestions.
